data.meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
data.sentence: The word اللَّهِ comes from the root ا ل ه and is associated with the meanings: to serve, worship or adore; to protect, grant refuge, preserve save, rescue, liberate; object of worship ie God; (Alif-Lam-Lam-ha) God, the one true God applied as a proper name denoting the true god, comprising all the excellent divine names; a unity comprising all the essences of existing things.
The word مِنَ comes from the root م ن and is associated with the meanings: From

data.meanings: to send a messenger, bestow, let go. rasul (pl. rusul) - envoy, bearer of a message, messenger. risalat - message, commission, mission, epistle. arsala (vb. 4) - to send. mursalat (pl. of mursalatun) - those sent forth.
data.sentence: The word رَسُولٌ comes from the root ر س ل and is associated with the meanings: to send a messenger, bestow, let go. rasul (pl. rusul) - envoy, bearer of a message, messenger. risalat - message, commission, mission, epistle. arsala (vb. 4) - to send. mursalat (pl. of mursalatun) - those sent forth.

data.meanings: To follow, walk behind, imitate, pursue, consecutive. To read, recite, peruse, rehearse, declare, meditate.Sought repeatedly, collect.Bond or obligation.One who relieves or aids another in singing.
data.sentence: The word يَتْلُوا comes from the root ت ل و and is associated with the meanings: To follow, walk behind, imitate, pursue, consecutive. To read, recite, peruse, rehearse, declare, meditate.Sought repeatedly, collect.Bond or obligation.One who relieves or aids another in singing.

data.meanings: to write or read, dig. sahfatun (pl. sihaaf) - hollow, large dish. sahiifa - surface of the earth. sahiifatun (pl. suhuf) - heap of a book.
data.sentence: The word صُحُفًا comes from the root ص ح ف and is associated with the meanings: to write or read, dig. sahfatun (pl. sihaaf) - hollow, large dish. sahiifa - surface of the earth. sahiifatun (pl. suhuf) - heap of a book.

data.meanings: to be or become clean/pure or free of dirt, made it or caused it to be distant/remote, cleanse/wash/purify, refrain, remove oneself, to clear/clean, ablution. Tay-ha/Ha-Ya = spread out, extend/expand.
data.sentence: The word مُطَهَّرَةً comes from the root ط ه ر and is associated with the meanings: to be or become clean/pure or free of dirt, made it or caused it to be distant/remote, cleanse/wash/purify, refrain, remove oneself, to clear/clean, ablution. Tay-ha/Ha-Ya = spread out, extend/expand.
